channel.title: latimes.com - Los Angeles Times
channel.description: The LA Times is a leading source of breaking news, entertainment, sports, politics, and more for Southern California and the world.

item.title: Calendar Letters: In reality, Oprah...
item.dc:creator: Ed Stockly
item.description: Props to Meredith Blake for her article on Oprah Winfrey’s uncanny ability to illuminate the pulse of our society’s mind-set [“Oprah Winfrey for President? Her Speech Resounds,” Jan. 8]. Winfrey’s most salient point was never directly referred to: “... what I know for sure is that speaking your...

item.title: False alert of missile attack sparks panic in Hawaii: 'We thought it was the real thing'
item.dc:creator: Sonali Kohli , Michael A.W. Ottey
item.description:
It was a beautiful morning on the Big Island of Hawaii as Kevin and Pamela Spitze drove to an art show in Hilo when the alert suddenly came on Kevin’s smartphone screen:

“BALLISTIC MISSILE THREAT INBOUND TO HAWAII. SEEK IMMEDIATE SHELTER. THIS IS NOT A DRILL.”

The Spitzes, who recently moved from...

item.title: Katie Couric responds to Matt Lauer allegations: That 'was not the Matt we knew'
item.dc:creator: Chris Barton
item.description:
In her first interview since allegations of sexual misconduct ended Matt Lauer’s run at NBC’s “Today” show in November, former cohost Katie Couric told People magazine that the often lurid details of his actions “was not the Matt we knew.”

“The whole thing has been very painful for me,” Couric...

item.title: Arson suspects sought in Pasadena church fire
item.dc:creator: Carlos Lozano
item.description:
Authorities are searching for those responsible for vandalizing a 129-year-old Pasadena church early Saturday and setting it on fire.

The fire was reported at about 2:20 a.m. at the Church of the Angels at 1100 N. Avenue 64, said Lisa Derderian, a spokeswoman with the Pasadena Fire Department....

item.title: Eliza Dushku says she molested at age 12 by 'True Lies' stunt coordinator Joel Kramer
item.dc:creator: Chris Barton
item.description:
Eliza Dushku, star of TV’s “Buffy the Vampire Slayer,” “Angel” and “Tru Calling,” came forward on Saturday to recount incidents of sexual abuse that she said occurred while she was working on one of her earliest roles as Arnold Schwarzenegger’s daughter in the film “True Lies” in 1994.

In a disturbing...

item.title: Lakers need overtime but pick up fourth consecutive win with 107-101 victory over Mavericks
item.dc:creator: Dan Woike
item.description:
The chance to win the game slipped through Julius Randle’s hands.

The Lakers went to the fourth-year forward during the final possession of the fourth quarter and the ball squirted away from him before he could get a shot off.

It was a disappointing moment — but it was quickly overshadowed.

Randle...

item.title: LiAngelo and LaMelo Ball go scoreless during pro debut in Lithuania
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
LiAngelo and LaMelo Ball went scoreless in their pro basketball debut, finishing a combined 0 for 7.

The younger brothers of Los Angeles Lakers rookie Lonzo Ball played in the Lithuanian league for BC Prienai on Saturday. Their team lost 95-86 to Lietkabelis Panevezys.

LiAngelo went 0 for 3 from...

item.title: False missile warning sent Hawaii residents into full-blown panic
item.dc:creator: Jessica Perez
item.description:
A false emergency message warning Hawaii residents of an incoming ballistic missile sent people scrambling in panic Saturday.

The alert, which was sent to cellphones and appeared on television, asked people to "seek immediate shelter" and added, “This is not a drill.”

Reaction quickly spread across...

item.title: College basketball: Michigan upends No. 4 Michigan State; No. 9 Oklahoma beats No. 16 TCU in OT
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
Moritz Wagner scored a career-high 27 points, lifting Michigan to an 82-72 victory over No. 4 Michigan State on Saturday in East Lansing.

The Wolverines (15-4, 4-2 Big Ten) have won eight of their last nine games this season and two straight against their rivals.

The Spartans (16-3, 4-2) are struggling,...

item.title: Four Democrats running against Rep. Dana Rohrabacher debate in Orange County
Residents call on candidates for governor to shut down Aliso Canyon gas facility
item.dc:creator: Maya Lau
item.description:
A mysterious disease is spreading through Kyoko Hibino’s neighborhood, but you’d never know it by glancing at her sunny, tree-lined Southern California community, she says.

The Porter Ranch resident has suffered bronchitis, heart palpitations, headaches and nosebleeds, none of which amount to a...

item.title: Hawaii residents tweet about hiding and crying after false missile warning
item.dc:creator: Jessica Perez
item.description:
A false emergency message warning Hawaii residents of an incoming ballistic missile sent people scrambling in panic Saturday.

The alert, which was sent to cellphones and appeared on television, asked people to "seek immediate shelter" and added, “This is not a drill.”

Reaction quickly spread across...

item.title: 101 Freeway, overwhelmed by Montecito mudslide, to remain closed indefinitely
item.dc:creator: Louis Sahagun, Matt Hamilton, Cindy Chang, Harriet Ryan
item.description:
As authorities continue to search for those missing in the deadly Montecito mudslide disaster, officials announced that U.S. 101 would remain closed indefinitely.

The 101, a major north-south artery that carries 100,000 vehicles through the Central Coast each day, was expected to open Monday, but...

item.title: Chelsea Manning will run for the U.S. Senate in Maryland
item.dc:creator: Associated Press

item.title: Hawaii officials say missile alert was a mistake
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
A morning alert that warned of a ballistic missile heading straight for Hawaii and sent residents into a full-blown panic Saturday was a mistake, state emergency officials said.

The emergency alert, which was sent to cellphones shortly after 8 a.m, said in all capital letters, "Ballistic missile...

item.title: Mark Wahlberg and WME to donate $2 million to Time's Up after pay-discrepancy controversy
item.dc:creator: Chris Barton
item.description: In the wake of a controversy sparked by reports that Mark Wahlberg earned roughly $1.5 million for reshoots on the set of “All the Money in the World” while costar Michelle Williams was paid only a fraction of that amount, Wahlberg and the agency that represents him, William Morris Endeavor, announced...

item.title: Trump lawyer brokered $130,000 payment to porn actress, report says
item.dc:creator: Associated Press

item.title: Report: Trump lawyer brokered $130,000 payment to porn actress
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
President Trump's personal lawyer brokered a $130,000 payment to a porn actress to prevent her from publicly discussing an alleged sexual encounter with Trump, according to a report Friday in the Wall Street Journal.

Trump met Stephanie Clifford, whose goes by the name Stormy Daniels in films,...

item.title: Former No. 1 Angelique Kerber ends drought by claiming Sydney International tilte
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
Angelique Kerber won her first title since the 2016 U.S. Open and extended her winning streak to nine matches to start the season with a 6-4, 6-4 win over Ashleigh Barty in the Sydney International final on Saturday.

The 2016 Australian Open champion and former No. 1-ranked Kerber won four singles...

item.title: Federica Brignone edges Lara Gut for super-G win; Lindsey Vonn is ninth
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
After winning a women's World Cup super-G at Bad Kleinkirchheim, Austria,, on Saturday, Federica Brignone dedicated her victory to Italian teammate Elena Fanchini.

The 32-year-old Fanchini had to end her season because of a tumor, forcing her out of her fourth Olympics in Pyeongchang next month.

...

item.title: The California deal: Accepting the calamity along with the splendor
item.dc:creator: Steve Lopez
item.description:
Yes, we have summer and at times a bit of winter, but the cycles in California follow a different calendar.

From drought to flood, from fire to mud, California bakes, burns and floats, always on the brink of calamity. We are here by the millions in defiance of reason, lured to a bountiful garden...

item.title: Reader suggests solution to CIF transfer issue
item.dc:creator: Eric Sondheimer

item.title: Varsity Times Insider: The latest sports news from Southern California's high school teams
Watch: California candidates for governor debate at USC town hall
Former classmate arrested in killing of Blaze Bernstein, the Ivy League student found dead in O.C. park
item.dc:creator: Richard Winton, Cindy Carcamo, Christopher Goffard, Emily Alpert Reyes
item.description:
Three days after the body of a missing teenager was found buried in a shallow grave in an Orange County park, detectives announced Friday that they had arrested a former high school classmate in the slaying.

Nineteen-year-old Blaze Bernstein was reported missing Jan. 3 by his family, who became...
